Package org.actioncontroller.meta

Interface ApiHttpExchange

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JdkHttpExchange, ServletHttpExchange
    public interface ApiHttpExchange
    Abstracts the interaction with the http request and response. This interface acts as an abstraction that enables Action Controller to work both with both the servlet API and HttpServer. ApiHttpExchange also provides convenience methods used by several HttpParameterMapper and HttpReturnMapping implementations.

    • Method Detail

      • getHttpMethod

        String getHttpMethod()

      • getServerURL

        String getServerURL()
        Returns the scheme, hostname and port part of the requesting URL, for example http://www.example.com or https://localhost:8443

      • getContextURL

        URL getContextURL()

      • getApiURL

        URL getApiURL()
        Returns the path to where the controllers paths are evaluated relative to, that is, the Servlet's context URL. For example, if an ApiServlet is bound as "/api/*" in a webapp mounted at "/app", getApiURL might return https://example.com:7443/app/api.

      • getPathInfo

        String getPathInfo()
        Returns the part of the URL after getApiURL. For example if a controller is mounted at https://example.com:7443/app/api and the client requests GET https://example.com:7443/app/api/hello/world getPathInfo returns "/hello/world"

      • getRequestURL

        String getRequestURL()
        Returns the whole URL, including query parameter. For example if the client requests GET https://example.com:7443/app/api/hello/world?greeting=Hello+There getRequestURL() returns https://example.com:7443/app/api/hello/world?greeting=Hello+There.

      • getQueryString

        String getQueryString()
        Returns the query string of the requested url. For example if the client requests GET https://example.com:7443/app/api/hello/world?greeting=Hello+There getQueryString() returns greeting=Hello+There.

      • getParameter

        Object getParameter​(String name,
                    Parameter parameter)
        Returns the specified query string of the requested url for a get request or x-www-form-urlencoded body parameter for a POST or PUT request. For example if the client requests GET https://example.com:7443/app/api/hello/world?greeting=Hello+There getParameter("greeting", ...) returns Hello There.
        Parameters:
        name - The query parameter name.
        parameter - The method parameter that this will be mapped to. Will be used to convert the value using convertTo(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.reflect.Parameter)

      • convertTo

        static Object convertTo​(String value,
                        String parameterName,
                        Parameter parameter)
        Converts the parameter value to the type specified by the parameter. Supports String, int, (long), (short), (byte), double, (float), UUID, (Instant), (LocalDate) and enums, as well as Optionals of the same.
        Parameters:
        value - The string value read from the http value
        parameterName - Used for exception messages
        parameter - the Parameter object from the method that this value should be mapped to. Needed to deal with optionals
        Returns:
        The value converted to a type compatible with parameter
        Throws:
        HttpRequestException - if the value is null and the parameter is not Optional
        HttpRequestException - if the value doesn't have a legal representation in the target type
